skill.name: Skill Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user wants to "create a skill", "add a skill to plugin", "write a new skill", "improve skill description", "organize skill content", or needs guidance on skill structure, progressive disclosure, or skill development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and guidance. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access. Pure markdown content for skill development best practices.

content.user_title: Create skills for Claude Code plugins
content.value_statement: Creating skills from scratch can lead to inconsistent structure and missed best practices. This skill provides a systematic six-step process for building effective skills with progressive disclosure, strong trigger descriptions, and proper resource organization.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through a six-step skill creation process
Explain skill anatomy: SKILL.md, scripts, references, and assets
Teach progressive disclosure for efficient context management
Provide writing style requirements: imperative form, third-person descriptions
Show validation checklist for quality assurance
Demonstrate skill structure with real examples from plugin-dev
limitations: This skill focuses on plugin skills, not standalone skill packages
Does not include skill packaging or distribution scripts
Does not provide auto-generation of skill files from templates

use_cases.title: Build new plugin skills
use_cases.description: Create skills for your plugin following best practices for structure, triggers, and organization.

use_cases.title: Improve existing skills
use_cases.description: Refactor bloated SKILL.md files using progressive disclosure and move details to references.

use_cases.title: Design skill taxonomies
use_cases.description: Plan skill contents by analyzing use cases and identifying reusable scripts, references, and assets.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a skill for [TASK]. Walk me through the six-step skill creation process.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill at [PATH] and suggest improvements for trigger phrases, writing style, and progressive disclosure.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill using the checklist. Check the description quality, body writing style, and resource organization.

prompt_templates.title: Structure guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain what goes in SKILL.md versus references/ versus scripts/ for my [SKILL TYPE] skill.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for PDF operations.
output: Define concrete usage examples: rotate PDF, extract pages, merge documents
Identify reusable resources: scripts/ for PDF tools, references/ for API details
Write SKILL.md with trigger phrases and imperative instructions

best_practices: Use third-person descriptions with specific trigger phrases: This skill should be used when the user asks to create X or configure Y.
Keep SKILL.md lean at 1,500-2,000 words and move detailed content to references/ files.
Write in imperative form: Start by reading the file. Validate input before processing.
anti_patterns: Using vague trigger phrases like provides guidance for X instead of specific user queries.
Putting all content in SKILL.md without using references/ for detailed documentation.
Writing in second person: You should do X instead of imperative: Do X.

faq.question: What is the difference between scripts, references, and assets?
faq.answer: Scripts contain executable code. References are documentation loaded as needed. Assets are files used in output like templates or images.

faq.question: What is the ideal length for SKILL.md?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md between 1,500-2,000 words. Move detailed content to references/ for progressive disclosure.

faq.question: How do skills work with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Plugin skills live in the skills/ directory. Claude Code auto-discovers skills with SKILL.md files.

faq.question: Is user data stored when using this skill?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance only. No data storage or transmission occurs.

faq.question: How is this skill different from the original skill-creator?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on plugin-specific skills with simpler manual structure instead of init_skill.py scripts.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for standalone skills?
faq.answer: No. This skill is designed for plugin skills distributed with Claude Code plugins, not standalone packages.
